intro: Phyllorkis guttulata, commonly known as the red-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are reddish in color, giving it its common name. Phyllorkis guttulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
